section.title: Cloud Admin
section.p:
As a Cloud Admin, you can create new domains, projects, users or remove them. You can also give admin privileges to users you create.
Do not create users in the default domain with admin privileges unless you want then to behave as Cloud Admin users.

section.title: Cloud Admin Activities
section.p: You must log into Horizon via the default domain using a cloud admin username and password to create, modify or remove domains, projects or users. Look at the Project picker at the top of the Horizon UI and ensure that the Default domain and the admin project BOTH have checks beside them. Typically, the demo project is selected by default, and this will cause issues if not changed.

sectiondiv.p: You can create new domains as a Cloud Admin.

ol.li: Select Identity and Domains in the sidebar
Click Create Domain from the list above the domains table
Enter a domain name and descriptions. In this example, TESTDOMAIN is the domain
The Enabled checkbox is checked by default
Click the Create Domain button

section.title: Set Domain context to the newly created Domain

sectiondiv.p: After you have created a new domain as the Cloud Admin, set the context.

ol.li: Select Identity and Domains in the sidebar
Click Set Domain Context button on the newly created domain. In the example, TESTDOMAIN is the newly created domain
Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar
Click Create Project from the list above the projects table
Note Domain ID and Name are immutably set to the new domain. In the example, TESTDOMAIN is the domain
Enter a project name and description
Note the Enabled checkbox is checked by default
Click Create Project button
Project Created

sectiondiv.note: Do not create users in the default domain with admin privileges unless you want then to behave as Cloud Admin users.

ol.li: Select Identity and Users in the sidebar
Click Create User from the list above the users table
Note Domain ID and Name immutably set to the new domain. In the example, TESTDOMAIN is the domain
Enter a user name, description, email address, password. In the example, USER1 is the user name.
Note the new project is preselected
Note the role _Member_ is preselected
Note the Enabled checkbox is checked by default
Click Create User button
User Created

section.title: Remove a user from a project

ol.li: Select Identity and Projects in the sidebar
Click Manage Members in the actions column for the project. In the example, TESTPROJECT is the project.
In the right column, click the minus ("-") beside the user to remove them from the project
Click Save to save the change

section.title: Assign Admin role to User within the new Domain

sectiondiv.p: You can assign admin privileges to a user within a domain.
sectiondiv.note: Assigning admin privileges to a user in the default domain gives them Cloud Admin privileges.

ol.li: Select Identity and Domains in the sidebar
Click Manage Members in the actions column for the domain
If necessary, in the left column, click the plus ("+") beside the user that should be the domain admin.
In the right column, click the dropdown beside the domain admin user and ensure that ONLY the admin role is selected by clicking it. Unselect any other roles selected by clicking them.
Click Save to save the change
Sign out of Horizon by clicking Sign Out
